intro: Comarostaphylis diversifolia var. planifolia, commonly known as the flat-leaf comarostaphylis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its broad, flat leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or coastal landscapes. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in horticulture, though it remains relatively rare in cultivation.
